item.title: Avoiding package lock-out when provisioning Ubuntu 18.04 machines
item.description: When provisioning a virtual machine running Ubuntu 16.04 or later, a common problem if being unable to install packages since another process is holding a lock (eg on /var/lib/dpkg/lock-frontend). This happens as Ubuntu VMs typically start several package-management programs unattended-upgrades and its associated apt.daily service — on boot, and these will block your provisioning scripts. You’ll see an error like this: E: Unable to acquire the dpkg frontend lock (/var/lib/dpkg/lock-frontend), is another process using it?

item.title: Installing the latest RabbitMQ on Ubuntu 18.04
item.description: I wasted a morning trying to install RabbitMQ v3.7.12 (the latest version as of Feb 2019) on an Ubuntu 18.04 machine using Puppet.
